item.title: This Week at Remap
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite really does come for everyone eventually, huh? At least, that's what I learned when my nine-year-old scrolled through a video promoting Kpop Demon Hunters coming to Fortnite, at which point she asked a fated question: "What's Fortnite?" Fast forward: most of the weekend was spent tell me she'd played enough and needed to find something else to do. (I'll probably be writing about this a fair bit on Crossplay in the future lol). Also, while it was nice to have a weekend where the Chicago Bears didn't stress me out, it just became a weekend where the Chicago Cubs did more than stress me out: they smothered my hope. Ah well.

-pk, who doesn't like losing a game in the first inning

  • PODCAST: HOA â€” The legend of Robâ€™s house and all its gifts only grows. Whatâ€™s inside the hot tub? What happens when part of the reason you bought the house was assuming you could sell your previous place? Where do you start drawing personal and professional lines in your place as an unexpected landlord? All thisâ€”and surely much, much moreâ€”on the latest episode of HOA.
    • We have already recorded a third episode of this lol
  • STREAM: Baby Steps â€“ Did I really commit to playing this entire game on stream? Did I realize how long this game really was? Well, nevertheless.
  • ARTICLE: Remap Recommends â€“ This has nothing to do with this, but I am going to try and put together a Shocktober list for you. It'll be a little late tho.
  • PODCAST: Remap Radio â€“ It will take everything in my power to not just play Super Mario Galaxy 2 and yap about it for an hour. I still might do that. On the plus side, we'll be joined by our old friend Danika Harrod!
  • ARTICLE: Letter Series â€“ Topic TBD!
  • STREAM: Coffee Shenanigans â€“ This stream was prompted by Rob sharing this message with us: "I smashed our glass French press carafe through reasons not my fault." ðŸ¤”

If you have any support issues, send details to support@remapradio.com

Patrick Klepek (he/him) is an editor at Remap. In another life, he worked on horror movie sets, but instead, he also runs Crossplay, a newsletter about parenting and video games. You can follow him on Twitter, Threads, Mastodon, and Bluesky.
